refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A bibliography. A DocBook bibliography may contain some preferatory matter, but its main content is a set of bibliography entries (either BiblioEntry or BiblioMixed). These may occur inside BiblioDivs, instead of appearing directly in the Bibliograpy.

refsection.title: Processing expectations
refsection.para: A Bibliography in a Book frequently causes a forced page break in print media.
Some systems may display only those entries within a Bibliography that are cited in the containing document. This may be an interchange issue. See .

The two styles of bibliography entry have quite different processing expectations. BiblioEntrys are raw; they contain a database-like collection of named fields. BiblioMixed entries are cooked; the fields occur in the order in which they will be presented and additional punctuation may be sprinkled between the fields.
See BiblioEntry and BiblioMixed for further discussion.
